resources.string: This app is meant to help people with forming good habits and preserving them xd

string-array.name: isYourHabitGood
string-array.item: Your habitat is poor
Your habitat is fine
Your habitat is good
Your habitat is great
Your habitat is thriving!

string-array.name: home_tips
string-array.item: Drink some water, your lips dry
Take a hike lad
Get enough rest
Organize your work
Boneless chicken

string-array.name: habit_facts
string-array.item: Small habits done daily matter more than big changes done rarely
Habits form faster when they are tied to an existing routine
Consistency is more important than motivation when building habits
Most habits are triggered by a specific cue or environment
Tracking a habit increases the chance of sticking to it
Bad habits are often easier to replace than to completely remove
Habits require less willpower once they become automatic
Morning habits tend to stick better than evening ones
Environment design can make or break a habit
Missing a habit once does not ruin progress, quitting does
Habits usually take weeks, not days, to become automatic
Simple habits are more sustainable than complex ones
Rewarding yourself reinforces habit formation
Stress often triggers old habits, even unwanted ones
Habits shape identity over time
Changing one keystone habit can improve multiple areas of life
Social support increases habit success rates
Habits work best when goals are clear and specific
Visual reminders help habits stay top of mind
Habits grow stronger when linked to personal values

string-array.name: frog_facts
string-array.item: Frogs do not drink water — they absorb it through their skin
Some frogs can breathe through their skin as well as their lungs
Frogs were on Earth long before dinosaurs went extinct
Not all frogs jump — some prefer walking or climbing
A group of frogs is sometimes called an army
Frogs shed their skin and often eat it
Tree frogs have sticky toe pads that work like natural suction cups
Frogs help control insect populations, including mosquitoes
Some frogs can freeze solid and survive winter
Brightly colored frogs are often toxic, not fashionable
Frogs blink to help swallow their food
Not all frogs croak — some chirp, squeak, or whistle
Frogs have excellent night vision
One frog species can lay over 20,000 eggs at once
Frogs are considered environmental indicator species
Some frogs can jump over 20 times their body length
Frogs cannot chew their food
Despite the fairy tales, kissing frogs rarely leads to royalty
Frog calls are unique enough to identify individuals
Many frog species are threatened by habitat loss
